thread.title: nubia N1 64GB storage variant launched in India for Rs 12,499
thread.title_full: nubia N1 64GB storage variant launched in India for Rs 12,499

title: nubia N1 64GB storage variant launched in India for Rs 12,499
text:
nubia N1 64GB storage variant launched in India for Rs 12,499 nubia N1 64GB storage variant launched in India for Rs 12,499 By February 6, 2017 “The nubia N1 features a 5,000mAh battery that can deliver 3.1 days of regular usage” 
In December last year, ZTE’s sub-brand nubia launched the N1 Android smartphone in India with 32GB of storage for Rs 11,999. Today, the company has launched a new variant of the phone in the country that comes with 64GB of storage. The higher storage model of the device is priced at Rs 12,499, and will be available in black and gold hues on Amazon starting February 8th at 12 am. 
Apart from the doubled storage, the rest of the specs of the new nubia N1 model are the same as the 32GB storage variant. The phone’s main highlight is its 5,000mAh battery, which can deliver 3.1 days of regular usage and 1.9 days of heavy usage on a single charge. 
The nubia N1 ( review ) features a premium aircraft-grade aluminium design and a rear-mounted fingerprint sensor. Its other specs include a 5.5-inch full HD display, a Helio P10 octa-core SoC, a 13MP rear camera with an LED flash, a 13MP selfie camera, Android Marshmallow, 4G LTE, dual-SIM slots, CDMA support, dual-band Wi-Fi, Bluetooth 4.1, GPS with GLONASS and a USB Type-C port.
